entries.meaning: (colloquial, chiefly US) Someone with rough manners; a rowdy or uncouth person. [from 19th c.]
(colloquial, chiefly US) An ironworker; a dirty or low-paid worker, a labourer. [from 20th c.]
(colloquial, chiefly US) A labourer on an oil rig. [from 20th c.]
examples: As for the minerals, there has been a good deal of drilling along the big river; trucks and roughnecks no longer garner any notice.

verbs.description: roughneck (third-person singular simple present roughnecks, present participle roughnecking, simple past and past participle roughnecked)

entries.meaning: To work as a laborer on an oil rig.
